programme.title: Hitler
programme.desc: A look at the mind of a dictator as Hitler tightens his grip on Germany and turns his sights to conquest. Experts investigate the key skills that enabled him to turn the tables on Europe's foreign leaders.(n)

programme.title: Hitler
programme.desc: Investigates Hitler's breathtaking rise from election defeat in 1928 to Germany's Messiah in 1933. Experts analyze his speeches, dissect his PR gift and interrogate the mind of a man who ruthlessly executes his closest comrade.(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: As WWII erupted, there was a race to develop new weapons and ways to wage war. Both the Allies and the Germans were searching for something that would give them a knockout blow and bring the war to a quick end.(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: By the end of June 1940, Hitler was victorious in Western Europe. Nazi Germany now controlled Denmark, Norway, the Netherlands, Belgium and France. Only Britain remained defiant. But the Fuehrer was certain that it could not hold out for long.(n)

programme.title: Nazi Death Squads
programme.desc: After the EZG's intervention, Romania, Bulgaria, Hungary and the Baltic states are declared.(n)

programme.title: Nazi Death Squads
programme.desc: After being judged at the Nuremberg trials, the majority of those responsible for the murders of nearly 1.5 million Jews would walk free in the 1950s.(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: By the autumn of 1940, Hitler's forces were supreme in Western Europe. Britain remained undefeated but the country was isolated and Hitler no longer considered it a threat. The Fuhrer was ready for his greatest gamble - Operation Barbarossa.(n)

programme.title: World War II in Color
programme.desc: Italy's dictator Benito Mussolini dreamt of recreating the Roman Empire. The Mediterranean would become Italy's lake with a great new colonial empire on its southern shore including British-controlled Egypt and Sudan.(n)

programme.title: The Zoo

programme.title: Project Grizzly
programme.sub-title: To Teach a Bear to Fish

programme.title: Project Grizzly
programme.desc: Jeff teaches the bears to forage in the wild, but Bob's foot is still a concern. When the bear slashes Jeff in the arm he refuses medical care. After he loses the bears, Jeff is forced to think about the difficulty of them actually leaving the nest.(n)

programme.title: Project Grizzly

programme.title: Swamp Wars

programme.title: Swamp Wars

programme.desc: Duff Goldman plans baby Josephine's first tea party and makes recipes perfect for tiny fingers to grab, like mini quiches filled with bacon and cheese, layered mini joconde sponge cakes and his decadent mini fudge bites.(n)

programme.title: Guy's Ranch Kitchen
programme.desc: Guy Fieri invites his friends to put a spin on some American classics. Eric Greenspan lays out lobster rolls, Maneet Chauhan serves a southern belle mint julep, Christian Petroni makes teriyaki meatloaf, and Justin Warner fires up fajita chimichangas.(n)

programme.title: The Kitchen
programme.desc: The Kitchen shares twists on takeout and making delivery favorites at home, including orange peel chicken, souvlaki, a giant double decker taco and spicy pork lettuce wraps. Plus, the hosts have some kitchen hacks that will change your life.(n)

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: America's favourite pastime comes to Flavortown when Guy Fieri invites three former Major League Baseball players to team up with GGG all-star judges in hopes of hitting a culinary home run.(n)

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Guy brings in chefs representing cuisines from all around the world to team up and fuse their cultures' flavours together. The teams create their best spicy dish to see which combination of cultures is the tastiest.(n)

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Some of the best world cuisine isn't prepared in restaurants, it's served in homes. Guy Fieri and his son Hunter invite three food-obsessed home cooks to share the international flavors they grew up on, starting with their signature global dish.(n)

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
programme.desc: Sure, Guy likes the savoury side of things more, but he knows in order to run a successful restaurant, you've got to have someone in charge of the sweets. And to prove it, he's invited three sweet and savoury duos to cook and bake for a shot at $20,000.(n)

programme.title: Guy's Grocery Games
